directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat.  Saute onions until lightly browned.  Stir in garlic and ginger, and continue cooking for 1 minute more.  Turn heat to low, add serrano peppers, and cook for an additional minute.  Sprinkle in the chili powder, cumin, coriander, garam masala, and turmeric; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Pour in tomato puree and ketchup; thin with water to desired consistency.  Stir in the paneer and peas; cook to soften peas, 2 to 3 minutes.  Stir in cream, and increase heat to medium-high.  Allow the curry to come to a rolling boil, and cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
ingredients: whipping cream or half-and-half to taste
title: Basic Indian Curry with Paneer
